document_data.name: Ma'mum al-Sahnan
document_data.nicknames: Revered Father, Humble Servant of the Enlightened Gods
document_data.mainbody: Caliph '''Ma'mum al Sahnan''', also called the '''Revered Father''' and the '''Humble Servant of the Enlightened Gods''', was the ruler of [[Mahabba]] in the [[Pantheist League]] of [[interior Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Description: Ma'mum was a [[half-elf]] who wore a his gray beard cropped close.
document_data.Personality: The caliph was a strict disciplinarian, giving off a fatherly vibe to his subjects. He was kind to those devoted to the [[Gods of the Pantheon]] and merciless to the [[Pantheist Enlightenment|unenlightened]] or misguided.
document_data.Activities: Ma'mum was determined to crush the heretical uprising of [[Bala|Balanites]] within his city and throughout the Pantheist League.
document_data.History: Long before he became caliph of Mahabba, Ma'mum established himself as a skilled warrior in combat against the savage tribes of the [[Cities of the Ancients|Ruined Kingdoms]]. He was selected to be the next caliph of Mahabba by [[Rimaq al-Nimar]] whose decision was approved in [[Huzuz]].
document_data.Relationships: Ma'mum was briefly married to his current Chief Vizier [[Tanatha]] who bore him three sons.
